website_summaries.verdict: It's almost impossible to find a more well-rounded unit in this price range.
pros: Stands out for its efficient yet powerful 1,300 watt operation, which ensures near-boiling water in seconds

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well made product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product, I now have two of them. Bought the first one after bad experiences with the Insinkerator brand (leaking tank, etc.) and didn’t like the fact that you couldn’t repair them. My first unit is about 5+ years old with no problems, second one is brand new. What I don’t like about the product is the same as the Insinkerator, you can’t get repair parts, so what should be a $3 set of “O” rings necessitates buying an entire new unit, WTF. Anyway, so far I’ve had good luck with this product and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Notchy

customer_reviews.title: FAUCET LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: Faucet looks cute and matches other stainless/brushed nickel faucets, but the HANDLE LEAKS all over when you pull it. The plumbing professional didn't disassemble the faucet to investigate, so now I have to try to resolve the issue. The tank and water lines are already run and installed, so resolution won't be fast or easy. I'm just outside the return window, so I'm going to attempt contacting customer service to see if they'll provide a replacement. (If this review has been updated, that means unsuccessful resolution and costly replacement.)
customer_reviews.author: A. Schottmuller

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware - unit started dripping right after warranty expired and no parts available
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit in July of 2014 so not quite two years ago. Started dripping from the spigot a couple months ago. I assume there is a bad gasket somewhere, but when I wrote to the company for parts or service, their response was no it has a one year warranty and no replacement parts are available. The unit works well and produces hot water, but it's of not much use with a constant leak or no repair parts available. Buyer Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ranck

customer_reviews.title: Does not last more than 3.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I have no issue with the product as they come, but I do have an issue that they all seem to last 3-3.5 years, and then something goes bad. Since installing originally in 2010 I had to replace the tank twice already. The original one stopped heating water. The first replacement started leaking after 3 years and 2 months. The new one is working so far, but I think the appliance without moving parts should last more than 3.5 years, especially if you charge that much for the unit that costs under $35 to manufacture. At least offer longer warranties, like some other companies.
customer_reviews.author: Watch Wearer

customer_reviews.title: They don’t make ‘em like they used to
customer_reviews.text: They don’t make ‘em like they used to. We had one of these and loved it for 5 years. Tank quit heating so we decided to buy the same model again, this time installed with a kitchen renovation. Plumber spent hours trying to get the faucet to stop leaking, but couldn’t fix it. The old one never had this problem. It appears that they have started making the faucet cheaper, and it leaks, and there’s no way to fix it. Returning it for a refund, but I’m out hundreds for the plumber’s time wasted. Ordered InSinkErator H-WaveSN-SS instead.
customer_reviews.author: GU3FAM

customer_reviews.title: Enough hot water for a party.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great instant hot. I bought one in Dec of 2013 and it's been providing hot water ever since. The only negative I can mention is when keep it at the hottest setting the water will bubble out of the spout which is normal because the steam has to escape some how. Prior to this one I had a couple of the common smaller ones. They never lasted more than a year and the amount of water they hold is a couple of cups of tea.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install, missing fittings, faucet leaks constantly unless pressure reducer is added
customer_reviews.text: After a trip to the box store to buy the missing fittings, and finally connecting the unit, to the water keeps dripping out of the faucet constantly (hot or cold) until I added a pressure reducer. now it only leaks a few drops near the handle when you open it - I can live with that but it will create water stains eventually. Poor faucet quality, poor installation manual and missing fitting pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Avital

customer_reviews.title: Started Leaking after 4 years
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to adjust temperature so that it wouldnt start boiling over and spontaneously start spurting out of the tap into the sink. Even then, some days we'd hear it start gurgling and blowing steam. 4 years after install, it started leaking underneath in our cabinet. There are two holes on the bottom of the tank that release ounces of water whenever the tap is turned on. Unit doesnt appear to be serviceable. Good thing I was under the sink looking for something soon after the leak started, otherwise this could have caused a ton of damage.
customer_reviews.author: Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Continuously leaks!!
customer_reviews.text: We had this exact item and used it daily for almost 8 years before it started to leak. We have since bought 2 more that have leaked profusely since the day of installation!! Very irritating and time consuming...not to mention expensive having someone come out and install these...just to have to remove them...we should have kept the 8 year old one and put up with the mild leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay J. Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for three years, but then...
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for three years of heavy use. It then flooded the inside of the cabinet under our kitchen sink, and onto the hardwood floor underneath. (Luckily the wood was well sealed and there's only minor damage to the floor.). When I dissassembled the unit, the plastic nut inside that connects the water entry tubing to the unit had sheared and every time I turned on the tap, the water poured out the bottom. There's no mechanical reason why it should have sheared, so I suspect that it was over tightened and cracked during manufacturing. Hopefully, that's just a random problem, since I just purchased are placement unit. I'll let you know in three years...
customer_reviews.author: WB Halper

customer_reviews.title: Costs almost as much to replace faucet as entire unit
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years, the faucet started to drip. We unplugged it, and after several days, it continued a slow drip. We thought probably faulty O ring or seal. After spending an hour on the phone with the manufacturer, I was informed the faucet needed to be replaced (duh). It cost almost as much as the entire unit (including the faucet) to order a new faucet. No other faucets will work with this unit. Cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I had to replace the first unit purchased several years and this unit has been improved. Ease of install and higher quality flex Stainless Steel braided hose connections make this a great value. Also the control seems to be more precise - that is - hold higher temperature with very minimal over temp faucet " spitting " when unit cycle up to the high near boiling water temperature. That's great!! I also purchased the extended warranty - was very reasonably priced. Would high recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 3 years ago and the water is down to a trickle. It worked great until a few weeks ago, but looks like I'll have to replace it. When you first start using it, the water also has a plastic taste to it because of the plastic tank. Took quite a few months for that taste to go away. I think I'll look around for something better to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ratliff

customer_reviews.title: So great, I bought it again
customer_reviews.text: I installed this at my old house and my wife didn't complain...that means she loved it. We moved to a new house and we have been missing having one, so I bought the same unit. The quality is great and the faucet is very attractive. the first one lasted more than five years without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. U.

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 6 months ago. My husband is a plumber and he installed it. It worked fine for 5 months then it started loudly spitting water out at random intervals. We turned the heat down and it stopped spitting water out but now the water doesn't get hot at all. I contacted the seller and they do not comply with Amazon return policy. They have their own terms and since it has been over 30 days I am out of luck. Needless to say this has been a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: renee hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Apparently good quality but failed in four months.
customer_reviews.text: Very promising start. Appears to be high quality with metal fittings and a very nice brushed nickel faucet. Installation was not difficult. BUT: it stopped heating water after 4 months. Disappointed. UPDATE 06.27.2016: Called Waste King customer service. They promise a new tank will arrive on Thursday. Will update again when it arrives. This may just have been a rare lemon; we will see!
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Was Five Stars, Now Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite thing about the remodeled kitchen. Having hot water on demand is super handy. UPDATE: Changing my review from 5 stars to 2 stars I had this professionally installed and worked great for about 1.5 years. Then, it suddenly stopped working. It no longer heats water. I contacted the manufacturer and followed instructions to reset the internal fuse and nothing worked. Even though it is just months out of warranty, the manufacturer would not offer any sort of replacement or discount on a new one. They also told me that it could not be repaired. This is a really disappointing lifespan for something like this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to reach warranty customer service
customer_reviews.text: The unit seems to be working fine,with the exception of 1 thing. When you try to dispense the hot water, if you push the handle in a certain way, water leaks from the handle area. The unit was installed by a plumber, and once the water temperature was adjusted to the way we like it, everything else seems to be ok. I have tried to call the warranty phone number included with the unit, but i only receive a voice mail which asks you leave your number and your call will be returned the following day. So far I have left 2 messages and no calls have been returned.
customer_reviews.author: P Durante

customer_reviews.title: The faucet looks good, matches the finish of the sink and existing ...
customer_reviews.text: Device works as expected. Installation was okay. I had to make a few trips to the hardware store for fittings as items supplied were not applicable to my install, but I have never installed anything plumbing related that did not need a few trips to the hardware store. I did tape the temperature control knob to prevent it from being bumped (and moved) by bottles and objects stored under the sink. The unit can boil water in its internal tank if set to maximum (which is noted in the instructions). Not a problem since taping the temperature setting. The faucet looks good, matches the finish of the sink and existing Delta water faucet and appears to be of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Repairman

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice unit, it does exactly what's it supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: After much research for an instant hot water dispenser/heater, I bought this one based on reviews over "the competition". No issues whatsoever with installation (a breeze), quality or workmanship. This is quite a nice unit, it does exactly what's it supposed to do, quickly, neatly and simply. I wanted this to use with my French Coffee Press - it works great in that application and I'm loving a great cup of coffee at a price so much better than that one cup dealy-whack that's been so popular the past few years. So nice to get back to basics and a great cup of coffee. Great transaction, quick delivery. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: I love this design as the tank is not pressurized
customer_reviews.text: The discharge spout is the vent and supply of hot water, so the tank is not under pressure. Installation was a breeze and I look forward to years of trouble free operation. I have installed around 6 of these over the years with the average life span of under 3 years for the 3 models I used in my home and the 3 I put into my father-in-laws home. They all failed in the same manner the vent tube would fail and leak water into the unit's electrics and burn them out. This unit does not have the same vent and separate supply piping scheme.
customer_reviews.author: bath

customer_reviews.title: Good Hot water and heated installation.
customer_reviews.text: The dispenser is very good...fast and quiet. Hooking it up was terrible. The instructions were wrong and countered each other. The main problem was that the inlet hose had a male coupling on the inlet side in stead of female. It took me and 2 Ace Hardware experts 2 hours to figure out how to configure a means to solve this problem. It required $12 worth of parts. I know Waste King is aware of this problem and can't believe they haven't resolved it yet. I suggest the author of the instructions and the product manager get together and spend a whole day trying to install a unit that should have taken 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: elku

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this a year ago, finally installed it... BELLISIMO! :D
customer_reviews.text: This thing... holy moly... This thing has CHANGED my mornings. I no longer have to worry about making coffee before work, I just use a french press now. And I can cook a hot bowl of instant oatmeal in just a minute! Hot cocoa? HUURRNGGG! YEAH! ANY TIME I WANT! It's pretty costly, but TIME IS MONEY. And this HAS saved me a BOATLOAD of time. Yes, it does need some fittings that aren't included, but a quick trip to my local BIG BLUE hardware store did the trick. I purchased a T-junction connector, a compression fitting, and a length of 1/4" vinyl water tubing, that's all I needed.
customer_reviews.author: jadoba

customer_reviews.title: Great value ... Waste King H711
customer_reviews.text: I've had this installed about three weeks ago and so far it's working great. I Had it installed by a plumber who stated he's installed this brand several times and hasn't heard any complaints. I was looking to replace my Insinkerator brand but they didn't have a faucet that went with my new kitchen faucet. The Waste King faucet I purchaed with the tank is brushed nickel and goes well with my new Kohler stainless faucet and soap dispenser. I will say that it doesn't get quite as hot as the Insinkerator but hot enough. The price of the Waste King is far less than the a Insinkerator brand.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: INSTALLATION instructions Vague
customer_reviews.text: Initially my plumber thought the unit was defective because it leaked water thru the toggle handle when depressed. In contacting the vendor to attain a replacement their service rep discovered the handle had been installed improperly, toggling perpendicular to front of faucet rather than parallel. After considerable time fiddling with the toggle and actually disassembling it the service rep repositioned the toggle which stopped the leak. Both plumber were experienced licensed plumbers... it cost me an extra $ 86 to discover the problem. The whole thing could have been avoided had the instructions clearly indicated the correct positioning of the toggle. They were very vague (service rep agreed) Make sure you check this when you install.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for several months now and are very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for several months now and are very happy with it! Does exactly what it is supposed to do, no problems. Was fairly easy to install (but I have to admit that my husband is very handy!) There seemed to be a lot of discussion about whether or not the faucet was supposed to swivel or not so I checked with the manufacturer - it is supposed to swivel. The only caution I would give, is to be sure that you have the handle (which operates the on/off) on the correct side so that you don't have to reach over the faucet to operate it - especially significant for a left-handed person!
customer_reviews.author: PSB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality , Very hot water .
customer_reviews.text: Better kitchen appliance ever - Really , Hot water propelled humans into civilization . Instant hot water on tap, , it dosen't get any better. Easy to install , plan on making 3 trips to plumbing supply store . I would recommend you buy the unit that comes with hot water faucet, (yeah you can buy one cheaper- Faucet) but this one is made for the hot water tank and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Inappropriate Name

customer_reviews.title: Last one lasted about 10 years.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I got 10 years ago. Old one finally gave out, but since it was so good, was pleased to find the same as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Parkside 18

customer_reviews.title: The one to buy!
customer_reviews.text: We have used instant hot water dispensers for a good many years. Had 4 high priced InSinkErators, which lasted from 18 to 24 months each. Found this WasteKing on Amazon and it is now on its fifth year with no problems at all. Considering purchasing another for a backup. Something this good, I'm afraid they will quit making it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M. Ireland

customer_reviews.title: Constantly drips
customer_reviews.text: We bought two units, about 18months ago, we had to return one immediately because would not stop dripping all day long. Then my mothers started dripping last week. We checked the on-line FAQ about turning the temp down etc. The only way to stop the dripping is to go out and buy another dispenser for $150. The other one that was replaced is still working fine. But I really wouldn't recommend purchasing this product.
customer_reviews.author: KDuncan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice piece of hardware
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased and installed at least 10 instant hot water dispensers over the course of my life. I put one in every house I live in. This Waste King model was by far the nicest piece of hardware out of all the different models I have ever purchased. Steel braided lines instead of copper pipe that made that part of the installation so easy. Heavy steel construction for the dispenser with no plastic parts. Very easy to adjust temperature control knob on the front of the tank. The only reason I couldn't give this product "5" stars is because the manufacturer supplied the wrong size fittings in the installation kit requiring a trip to the hardware store to rectify.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Bouffard

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted... which was exactly 7 months.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and worked great, but only for 7 months and then it burned out and just stopped working. The electrician came and trouble shot it, the power to the unit was fine, the unit simply stopped working after 7 months of light use. The hassle of getting it repaired or dealing with a manufacturer is simply not worth it, but feel an appliance of this nature should last at least a year, especially since I only use it every few days.
customer_reviews.author: Ocosta PTO

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, confusing instructions
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well and has an attractive faucet that matches the regular faucet in our kitchen. This a replacement for one that had started leaking. I installed it myself and found the instructions confusing. They attempted to color code and number the parts bags and match those colors and numbers to the instructions, but things must have changed since the original design and parts didn't match up with the instructions. I eventually figured out what they really meant, and I was able to do the installation. The device works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Autoxer

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect installation instructions and missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Dispenser seems fine but instructions and parts were lacking. Very frustrating installation. After 3 trips to home depot we finally got it installed, but really, can't they make sure the instructions are right and apply to the enclosed item. And as for missing parts, well that's just another frustration. The parts were only a few dollars but the hassle of having to go to the store to get them only to find out we were still missing something else was very annoying! Looks nice. I would've given a higher rating if it weren't for these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra V.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Constantly drips water, like every seconds. Thought the first one, that we got when we remodeled our kitchen, started dripping after about 3 years. Professional plumber could not fix it. Bought the 2nd one here because we like the look of the model. Started dripping immediately even though professionally installed and the plumber coming a 2nd time to try and figure out how to fix it. So we've wasted a bunch of money for the purchase of the product and the plumber. So NOT !!!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: This was a replacement of the same product, different ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement of the same product, different faucet, bought together. After installing the faucet, I went to connect the unit. There are no directions included on how to install this faucet. I called the company only to find out there are no directions to install THIS faucet, bought as one packaging and that I may need other pieces not included.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I can hear the dripping throughout the whole house like a freaking nightmare excerpt fron The Telltale Heart
customer_reviews.text: This faucet has dripped CONSTANTLY since it was installed. By a professional, not a DIY install. I can hear the dripping throughout the whole house like a freaking nightmare excerpt fron The Telltale Heart. Add you can't turn it off because it's actually plumbed in to the supply line. This is what the military would call a POS. The plumber adjusted and replaced washers. I've adjusted and replaced washers. Freaking Nightmare POS.
customer_reviews.author: Warner

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality material
customer_reviews.text: The finish is flimsy and smaller compare to Costco one, the rod that supports the heads breaks almost right away, stainless steel poor quality, after few months use shows signs of rust. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: henry c.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks after warranty expires!
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 years the faucet drips and dribbles continuously. Have had plumber try to repair, but the faucet is crap. The water heats fine, but there is no replacement faucet or parts. So, we have to buy a new one. DIFFERENT BRAND!
customer_reviews.author: mom2boys

customer_reviews.title: These water heaters are the best quality for the lowest price
customer_reviews.text: This purchase replaced an identical water heater after the dispenser handle wore out after three years. These water heaters are the best quality for the lowest price. It is a shame you cannot order replacement parts for these units, since indivdual components can be problematic. We use ours daily, though, so investing in a new unit was worth it. It does not operate flawlessly; the faucet sputters hot water whenever the tank reheats, a source of fascination and danger to my pets (they have not been burned, yet). Turning down the temp helps keep this from happening, but I like the temperature higher for hot beverages.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We had to go to the hardware store twice, and then find a 3/4" piece of copper tubing to get it installed. This is the first Waste King we have had. We have had a different brand for our last two. Installation wasn't the easiest. Even parts included weren't the correct part. We will see how well it works and lasts. I will update after a month.
customer_reviews.author: Willowkara

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.  Excellent company.
customer_reviews.text: The best hot water dispenser I have found. Bought this to replace one that was 8 years old. The product has improved considerably. Cudo's to Anaheim Manufacturing. After installing I had a problem with a leak out the top of the spigot. I contacted them and they were very helpful They sent a replacement right away. Excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger Hostetler

customer_reviews.title: but this little Hot Water Dispenser makes me so happy. I use it every day
customer_reviews.text: We had our kitchen redone with new counters, new range, new stainless steel sink and dishwasher, but this little Hot Water Dispenser makes me so happy. I use it every day, multiple times. We drink a lot of tea, and I have started to use instant coffee simply because of the ease of use of this item. I make oatmeal and hot chocolate and how many other recipes call for hot water. Plus, if the water in my sink gets a bit cool, I can simply add some heat with this device, rather than waiting for the water to arrive from the water heater in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: It's 2015 people!  Get out of the dark ages and get this item.
customer_reviews.text: works excellently. you gotta get one for your house. once you do you will wonder why you it took you so long. Seriously, in the "old days" if we wanted coffee we would have to: 1) Start a fire (either with sticks or burning gas on our range) 2) fill up a tea kettle (with way more water than you need to actually boil) 3) Place it on the stove ... then wait for an unpredictable amount of time 4) When, after waking up everyone else in the house due to very loud whistling of the stupid tea kettle, you had your water! or ... use this and pull one lever and in 3 seconds you are done!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Huckle

customer_reviews.title: Great for making iced tea right in a glass pitcher!
customer_reviews.text: The unit and installation was as previously reviewed by many. We never knew how much we would use this but do we ever use it. I needed to come up with a good way to share the disposal circuit so I simply changed the disposal switch to a three way, ran new 3 wire /g from the switch to an outlet below the sink and split the hot side of the receptacle. Now I have a safe circuit that won't overload if the heater is on and the disposal is turned on since only one half of the receptacle is hot at anytime, i.e. the heater is off while the disposal is running. Three way switches aren't just for lighting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had my hot water dispenser very long, but so far I am really satisfied with the unit. I had 3 other hot water dispensers by insinkerator I had trouble with all of them due to leaking poor made parts etc. Told myself I wouldn't buy another one, we did miss not having one because of convenience. So far this one has been a great unit, I found it very to install, especially since I had already had one previously. I am rating this one high because of the ease on installation, very good quality parts matches everything I have installed on my sink. Everyone who has used it has been very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Easy and handy
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and works like a charm. If it begins to spit a little it's simple a thermostat adjustment needed. You will use it a lot if you're a big fan of tea or making quick ice coffee. There, I said it... ice coffee with insta hot water is so quick and easy if you have the right vessel for refrigerating after instant brewing. And there is no watery coffee breakdown either. Enjoy this handy, essential kitchen addition.
customer_reviews.author: J'. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it zero stars I would! This was supposed to be the greatest feature of our kitchen, but it leaks non stop. It drips from the faucet constantly and around the base water just flows out. We have checked everything time and time again, but it’s not the installation.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT...........
customer_reviews.text: Most of the positive reviews on this product appears to be Fake. I would stay away from this product at any cost. I have changed two of these units in less than two years and the company is refusing to honor their warranty in my last attempt to get this product serviced. I would not pay $1 for this peace of garbage. Keep your money and invest it in a more reputable company and something that does not break every year.
customer_reviews.author: Farzad

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with a Kenmore hot water dispenser in our old house, so I bought this for our new place. But this Waste King hot water dispenser did not fit right from day one. It loosens quickly, I think because the countertop is thicker than the fittings can accommodate. Water sputters and comes out slowly at first, instead of a steady hot stream like the Kenmore. The tall thin spigot is flimsy. I'd buy a different model / brand given the chance to do over...
customer_reviews.author: Akumal

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with customer service. The faucet leaked before we could even use it. Called and received guidance on correcting installation problem, but still leaked. Manufacturer replaced faucet and it works like a charm. Only criticism I have is the initial taste of the water. Without a filter (which I still don't have) the water had a metallic, chemical taste. I have either gotten used to it or the newness has worn off. Either way, I Love it!
customer_reviews.author: cherie lovas

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The water heater appears to be very well made for the price. Installation was fairly simple once it was connected to a cold water valve which is not included. I also connected a filter to the input even though there is a particle filter included in the incoming water line of the heater. I had to install a 120v outlet below the sink to plug it in. The literature claims it only uses as much electricity as a 40 watt bulb. It was installed in the kitchen of a small office so it will get plenty of use. So far it's been there for a couple of weeks and seems to be working as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great kitchen upgrade
customer_reviews.text: So convenient to not have to wait for the hot water to come through. This is a great kitchen upgrade. I use it multiple times per day and can't imagine not having it. After about a year, the flow volume became very slow. Customer service was useless and offered no suggestions. My plumber eventually noticed that the ring that goes around the on/off handle had worked it's way loose and he tightened it fixing the problem. Good as new!
customer_reviews.author: PleaseNoJunk

customer_reviews.title: Good product after replacement
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces an older under counter heater that started leaking. The first unit we purchased had a leak at the base of the handle. I attempted to go directly to the manufacture to have the handle replaced under warranty but found that difficult. Amazon was good about replacing both the heater and spigot which I installed. The replacement is working well. I would recommend this product for instant hot water at your sink tap
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Former Incinerator User
customer_reviews.text: These are quite economical comparative to the big box stores. Relatively easy to install if you are replacing an existing (you need power and a water source) - it has very short hoses which you really should use because of the water temperature. The instructions suck!! You will likely need extra parts - look on forums one guy gave good guidance on what type of fittings you have on hand. I was not going to replace my current unit because of the price of the replacement - until I found this on Amazon, very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service by manufacturer!.
customer_reviews.text: Great while it worked, but quit heating in less the one year. That isn't long enough to keep me happy..Two stars. EDIT: Although a bit out of warranty AMC replaced the heating unit at no charge to me and shipped the new unit out the same day I called them. I could not ask for better customer service... and as I mentioned at first, the instant hot water is a big hit in my house. Given the company behind the product this definitely rates 5 stars. I am REALLY happy now.
customer_reviews.author: BobH

customer_reviews.title: Easy Fix! We use this faucet every day.
customer_reviews.text: Read the JBlairKing review for a great detail on how to fix the leak. I can confirm that the o-ring size is correct. Also, the 17/32 socket they mention is also correct, but a 14mm will work as well. I could not find a 17/32 locally, and ended up grinding down a 14mm to thin the walls, just as JBlairKing had to do. After the simple, inexpensive repair, we love and use this faucet many times a day. It's perfect for heating up/sanitizing baby bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Hawfunk

customer_reviews.title: I just had it installed today and it does not ...
customer_reviews.text: I just had it installed today and it does not work. I tried to ask for a return and it said it was no longer eligible for a return. I am an OLD lady, single, Handicapped, and I didn't even open the box until this past Friday when I got my handyman to install it.I certainly could not install it myself and he was not available for awhile. I didn't' think it sat in the box in the entry for a month but I guess it must have. At any rate it should not be unreturnable when it is flawed. I intend to pursue this but don't have time right now. I am going out of town for two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Montana

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over Franke
customer_reviews.text: The major design flaw of the Franke version was a plastic tube that could not be replaced between the faucet and the hot water heater. That tube melts at the connection with the heater and, after shortening it a few times, you have to replace the faucet. In this design, the plastic tube can be replaced at both ends, so that the repair costs a few bucks instead of a few hundred. We have installed this system one month ago and it works well. A small leak shows up if you tilt the faucet handle too far. The temperature of the water is a bit lukewarm, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Jean W.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing!!! I've had it for about a year now and it isAWESOME! It was well worth the money. I will never be without one in my house. This is actually the first time I have had a hot water dispenser. I actually never new they made them for home use. The time saves me in the morning when fixing my tea on the way out the door makes this thing worth 3 times the price to me. The only knock I have is that I had to make a couple of trips to home depot for a couple of connectors that do not come with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul

customer_reviews.title: Bewater
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit for a new build home. Kitchen just completed and this was installed by a professional plumber last week. It leaks like crazy. The unit has to be replaced now with another brand. Very disappointed. Not a good unit. Too late for me to replace it since I purchased it in September 2017 in anticipation or a new house.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Dripping Faucet on install = sad times
customer_reviews.text: Hot water heater installed and is working great, but the faucet drips whenever the boiler runs. I thought this was due to the water getting too hot and this being a release mechanism, but even with the water temp turned way down (where the water is warm), the faucet still drips. I would love to just exchange the faucet and not uninstall and repackage everything, but we'll see how that goes given my experience with an all or nothing return policy @Amazon. Provided everything worked this would have been an excellent product, that it shipped faulty = 2 stars since I have to do it all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Justin S.

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: after reading many reviews on the hot water dispenser I finally decided on the Waste King. First of all because of the price and then the reviews were most helpful. While others leaked and did not perform after a period of time Waste King did not have those issues. It is a wonderful addition to our new kitchen and my husband who likes a good cup of tea is having a great time. We have not tried the hot cereal but everyone says it is a must try. Glad we purchase the Waste King
customer_reviews.author: MimiD

customer_reviews.title: Works ok - but ships with incompatible parts and instructions - be ready to buy your own parts to install it
customer_reviews.text: Once I finally got the unit hooked up it worked well - however the tank ships with all 1/4" push-to-connect fittings and the faucet that comes with the kit is 3/8" compression fittings - so after a trip to Home Depot and a couple fittings/adapters to be able to make the connections it is ok. Too expensive a product to come with 2 non-compatible components and each component had it's own instruction sheet which didn't agree with the other. All-in-all would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: heno123

customer_reviews.title: Six years later,
customer_reviews.text: still working. Hope I don't jinx it but, so far, not one malfunction, service call, or problem of any kind, and it has already lasted longer than any of its predecessors, so I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: carriew

customer_reviews.title: Horrible chemical / plastic taste
customer_reviews.text: Plastic/chemical taste that did not go away. Had to return it after 2 months when the taste did not go away. Very disappointed because had to have a hole drilled in my granite and a plumber install it. To Waste King's credit, they did send me another one (which was no better). Ultimately, Waste King asked me to submit my receipts and said they will reimburse me the money I spent. Ultimately put in an Insinkerator which had an off taste for about a week, and after flushing it 3x, the taste went away.
customer_reviews.author: Paige NeJame

customer_reviews.title: Hot water Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Great accessory to the kitchen sink, delivers very hot water. You may need another electrical outlet under the sink (not really an easy task) - the manufacturer recommends a dedicated circuit - definitely not an easy chore, especially if you are not do a complete remodel of your kitchen. Nice look. Only distraction to the dispenser is that you a bit of patience when the hot water comes out when you first turn it on; you will wait about 2 seconds for the water to start being delivered than it is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Rulli

customer_reviews.title: Waste king instant hot water dispenser.
customer_reviews.text: This unit was easy to install and has worked well. After several months it started spitting out hot water once or twice a day. I turned it down to about half way , we have quite hot, then turned it back up the next morning. This solved the problem. We are on a well and even though it is filtered we probably have lime and other hard minerals. If it happens again I may try cleaning it with CLR. Over all it has worked pretty well. I like the fact that it came with a nice handle and curved spout that you have had to buy separate if you bought one at Lowe's or Home Depot. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Demas

customer_reviews.title: Valve lever leaks - also on replacement.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 4 year old model of the same. The old model worked well until a nylon compression cap cracked. Annaheim Mfg. replaced it with a brass fitting. Then the lever spring rusted and broke. I replaced that on my own. Then the heater burnt out. On installing the slightly revamped version, the valve lever leaked all over the counter from the valve stem. Amazon sent a replacement which promptly did the same. Anaheim Mfg. really needs to do a better job at quality control. Do they get a third chance? I'm calling the manufacturer tomorrow... we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Ann Richardson

customer_reviews.title: ... replace my prior Quick&Hot so installation should have been easy. It was not
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace my prior Quick&Hot so installation should have been easy. It was not. The instructions were incomplete and provided almost no substantive guidance. However, the most frustrating thing was that the parts supplied to connect the faucet to the tank did not match the tank. After several frustrating hours of trying to figure out what I was doing wrong, I finally realized that the connections for the faucet and tank would not match. I returned it, purchased a different brand at Lowes and had it installed in 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: T French

customer_reviews.title: It drips within a couple of months.
customer_reviews.text: Failed. It dripped water near the handle and out of the mouth of the spout. I replaced it and the second eventually did the same. I replaced it with a different device.
customer_reviews.author: G. Newsom

customer_reviews.title: Works well...not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy install and it looks and works great. The biggest drawback is that you cannot leave it turned up on high. We turn it down after making coffee in the morning...if you don't it will sputter steam every time the heating element cycles. We still have very hot water throughout the day...just not 195 degree coffee making water.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Carr

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but only worked for 2 days before it started dripping from the faucet part.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael

customer_reviews.title: This leaks!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Waste King H7-11 we have ordered. Instructions were followed to a T and this leaked out of the top all over new construction. We are returning it for a full refund. We called manufacturer and installed and made adjustments exactly as we were instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Kollenkark

customer_reviews.title: So pleased with Waste King over ISE!
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed this in April after first having installed ... gave it a good review. Now, after many months of usage, I'd like to add it is SO much better than the InSinkerators I have had for YEARS. I've had the ISE installed in probably 6 different homes over many years and this brand, the Waste King, is more reliable, less noisy and SO much better. I am absolutely thrilled to NOT hear the ISE constant noise and sputtering! This brand is quiet and does not sputter. Go for it, bet you'll be as pleased as I am!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but NOT energy friendly desing
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, and easy to install as long as you have a little plumbing experience. Water tastes something chemical flavor especially it gets cold. It may be an initial issue. Hot water connect adopter with this unit does not work well and I used my own from Home Depot. This is the old design with a water kettle inside and keeps it hot all the time with 1300 Watt heater on and off every several minutes. They could re-design and make it more energy friendly to meet current environment.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Installation Help
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of comments on here about the difficulty in finding the fittings to install this. It is not that it doesn't come with fittings, but it comes with the wrong end on the water inlet line. Every water valve that I could find, along with the adapter T-fittings come with a male outlet. There aren't any female x female fittings available at Home Depot or Lowes. I was able to find a 12" Dishwasher Hose that had the correct fittings on each end. I is a little awkward installing a length of hose to another length of hose, but it did the trick. If you need some extra length, you can get longer lengths.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Slaugh

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the product and delivery time. The best installation is to have a 3/8 male supply line to hook up to. You will then need a small braided line with a female end on both sides. Note! This hook up is with no filter. You will end up with a few extra plastic connectors when not using a filter. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star was the supply line would be so much easier to hook up if it had a female end instead of a male end.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the second instant hot water heater we have gotten from waste king and it is working well. I gave it 4 stars rather than 5 because the last instant hot water heater only lasted 4 years before it started to leak and caused a flood under the sink. We hope this model does not have the same problem, but we will see. Love the instant hot water, saves running the tap tp get hot water which is critical in California here water is at a premium.
customer_reviews.author: prince kuyper of california

customer_reviews.title: Quality appears good but some simple design improvements would be great
customer_reviews.text: I installed this today, everything installed correctly and it works well. The dispenser that mounts to the sink has a real nice finish and feels well made. The unit requires you to mount a nozzle on top, which appears would be real easy to mount and install during manufacture. The other fittings from the dispenser top the unit could also be designed with simple threaded connectors in the same way that the lines connect to the dispenser. Otherwise the unit was dispensing hot water in minutes and appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: No Pen name

customer_reviews.title: shoots water out really fast.
customer_reviews.text: This feels well made. The only complaint I have is how fast the water comes out. It comes out so fast, that I can't really use it just to hold stuff under that I want rinsed with boiling water. Like baby bottle nipples. It shoots the water out way to fast and will scald you. But it's a good look, & matches our faucet perfect. It's great for instant coffee & tea. I never hear it. Our old one that we had, different brand, I could always hear when it was on boiling. this one is very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: TimeTraveler

customer_reviews.title: Faucet has already failed
customer_reviews.text: Faucet has already failed (leaking like Old Faithful) and it's not even been a year. It also has a tendency to blast steaming water into the sink every hour or so if it's turned up all the way. Very disappointing, especially at this price-point.
customer_reviews.author: Il Dottore

customer_reviews.title: If your handle is leaking... try this.
customer_reviews.text: Right after I installed everything, the faucet leaked where the handle is. I found that if you loosen the top retaining nut (I used a crescent wrench) the leak stopped. You might have to play with yours to find that sweet spot but it should work. Directions suck but if you have basic plumbing knowledge you should be fine. You do have to buy some additional parts so check the instructions for your particular situation. Just hope it lasts longer than some of the other reviews I read.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Instructions, what instructions?
customer_reviews.text: The product works well, but it was a bear to install. Why be so cryptic in the instructions? Thank God for the info provided in the reviews here, because the instructions are beyond useless. Why not take a few minutes and type up useful, step by step instructions that are clear and specific? Also, unless you have 1/4" fittings from you supply line, AND you are able to mount it within 18 inches of the faucet, you're in for some creative plumbing.
customer_reviews.author: Northern CO

customer_reviews.title: We absolutely love the efficiency of having the instant hot water
customer_reviews.text: This is the second house that I put one of these in. We absolutely love the efficiency of having the instant hot water.........when it works. In the first house the unit burned out after about a year........the company replaced the tank at no-charge which was nice. This new unit was installed in our brand new home ....it worked for about 3 weeks then 'no hot water'! I reached out to the company and explained the situation......the response was that I must have my receipt for replacement. I just found the receipt and am still within the warranty period so they will replace the tank. I wish that it would be more reliable .......save your receipt!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Dobis

customer_reviews.title: Made my mom happy
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product. It is very reasonably priced. I read some reviews about needing a particular fitting... Sure you will. You are installing a plumbing part in your house. All houses are different. Open it up before you start, figure out what you will need, and get it all before you start. It's not rocket science, just normal DIY. If you start anything planning on "everything" going perfect and all the parts you need being there... You should probably hire a plumber.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Patriot 85

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great!  Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: As one of the other reviewers commented it did take one trip to the hardware store for fittings. (Of course the standard joke is that it takes 3 trips to complete a plumbing job) Price was also a factor. Replacing one I installed 6 years ago I found the price had more than doubled for the same unit I had (and it was partly plastic). Found this unit at a more "affordable" price. One last comment for all the users reporting short lives of there dispensers. The factory settings for this type of product seems to be 192 or 193° . Dropping about 10° seems to double there lives.
customer_reviews.author: fast_f100

customer_reviews.title: Drips- can’t reach customer service
customer_reviews.text: The faucet drips CONSTANTLY- tried to call customer service several time and never get to talk to anyone- sent an email to some service address that the recording gave but days later have never heard from anyone- I will try one more time- then I will have no choice but return it. The drop will fill a cereal bowl in about 45 minutes-
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for a better product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Because I've installed 3 insinkerator InstaHots I have enough experience installing that this was easy to install. I did have to buy a WATTS LFA-157 fitting to tie in the existing 1/4 inch copper cold water line. The Quick&Hot runs quieter than the InstaHot. I noticed the price seems to be creeping up after I bought mine. I saved $150 over the cost of the InstaHot. I hope Anaheim doesn't make the same mistake as Insinkerator on pricing and quality over the long run. Excellent product right now but I've become cynical and skeptical about these consumer manufacturers. I enjoy seeing a better product sold at an affordable price when one of my favorite companies get sloppy and price gougey.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Product Works, Instructions Almost Worthless
customer_reviews.text: The installation instructions included with the hot water unit were for a different faucet handle than we purchased. Once I figured that out (a waste of an hour or longer trying to determine what they were talking about!) then it went quite quickly. As noted in other reviews the Dispenser faucet cold water inlet line wasn't the same size fitting as my plumbed-in line so I had to buy a couple of adapters ($13 worth) to get it to work. But, as I said in my Subject heading, the hot water part seems to work great now that it's installed. Then again it's only been operating for a few days. We'll see if it lasts a few years...
customer_reviews.author: Dawnco

customer_reviews.title: OUCH
customer_reviews.text: I had to return it. After a very difficult and expensive plumber install it essentially exploded in a steam cloud.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Adams, MD

customer_reviews.title: Well made (so far - new user) and attractive.  Hard to install.
customer_reviews.text: The dispenser looks great but was a bear to install (even by plumber). The base unit is much larger than I thought. Google for dimensions of the base unit! I was replacing the HOT-1 (like others) and the base unit takes up a LOT of room under the sink. I was also surprised that the connectors between dispenser and base unit were not matching (i.e. 1/4" .vs. 3/8") and require couplers.... why couldn't they use the same diameter!!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: Works great now that I have it installed. Installation is not too difficult but it would probably have been worth it to save the headache and have a professional do it. I had to go purchase some additional parts to make it work in my installation. It took a couple nights to get it done and I could have made more money in that time easily doing side jobs where a professional plumber probably could have installed it in 45 minutes. I purchased this because my insinkerater broke after 6 years. I hope this one lasts longer and has more metal and less plastic inside. Great price here on amazon for the kit with a very nice looking faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Diesel

customer_reviews.title: OK but short life
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for about 3.5 years - then suddenly it went crazy one night, got so hot all the water came gushing out and when that was gone it was spitting steam out constantly. It was clearly overheating, lost its regulation and since the change was so sudden it clearly was not enough to turn down the heat control knob. Glad it happened when we were home to unplug it. Disappointing it failed after such a short time (our previous heater, a different model, lasted more than 10 years). Will try a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Sonuvagun

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I always hate waiting for water to boil, or heat up in the microwave. This solved all of those problems. It comes out piping hot and ready to use for instant noodles, hot cocoa, or anything you need really hot water for. In the winter we use it a ton because it is really cold where we live and we are constantly drinking hot chocolate and in our big family, everyone gets all the hot water they need and want! Great purchase for our home.
customer_reviews.author: Skeitz

customer_reviews.title: There is no way to make this work. Turning ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no way to make this work. Turning the temperature a little up, it starts leaking or puffing hot gas; turning the temperature down a little, water is lukewarm. Turning it back up, we can smell a burning smell. We tried. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: mm

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Started leaking at 3 1/2 years. Found out a new faucet costs as much as a complete unit.
customer_reviews.author: BW in Spokane

customer_reviews.title: Great Hot Water Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I had a friend help me change my old Insinkerator with this great looking Waste King one. After reading all the reviews, I have to agree, it was well worth it and at a fraction of the price of the Insinkerator. Be careful of the setting as putting it on the maximum hot setting can cause the unit to overheat and spit out steaming hot water by itself. The wife loves it for her teas!
customer_reviews.author: mr.chinatown

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later started not providing hot water and then started leaking
customer_reviews.text: Product heated great but faucet would leak if water was too hot. Could not have on hottest setting but it was hot enough for hot drinks. After nearly 4 years the tank stopped heating the water for a day and the next day it worked. Then about 2 wks later started leaking out bottom of tank. Planning to replace the tank... haven't decided if I will purchase this one again yet or not.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not user serviceable friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Most attractive dispenser available but suffers a quality control issue. Best to purchase 2 or more if you want to complete installation in 1 session. My experience took 3 units before a usable install. First unit dripped continuously. Second unit had as much water flow out of the valve area as the faucet. The third unit was a winner. Be aware that the faucet has no user serviceability so it's back to the manufacturer for service. This unit is still my 1st Choice for design but would not recommend for user installation.
customer_reviews.author: C. Walden

product_meta.title: Waste King H711-U-SN Quick & Hot Water Dispenser Faucet & Tank - Satin Nickel,Medium
product_meta.description:
Instant hot water dispenser 1300-Watt hot water tank and Coronado Collection faucet included. Part number H711-U-SN is a combo unit which includes both hot water tank and satin finish faucet (AH-1300-C-hot water tank & H711-SN-satin finish hot water faucet).

AMAZON.COM




Delivers up to 100 cups per hour of instant 
near-boiling water (view larger). Add the convenience of instant hot water to your kitchen with the Waste King H711-U-SN hot water dispenser kit, which includes a 1300-watt hot water tank and elegantly curved Coronado faucet in satin nickel. You'll have near-boiling water at your fingertips (up to 190 degrees F) to help you prepare instant drinks like tea and hot chocolate, instant soups, and more. No need to wait for the water to boil, no water waste, and no mess.

The H711-U-SN hot water dispenser offers fingertip adjustment, enabling you to switch the water temperature from 140 degrees F to a near-boiling 190 degrees F. The 1300-watt heating element provides a fast recovery time, and the large 5/8-gallon reservoir delivers a generous 100 cups-per-hour capacity. It's also highly energy efficient, using less electricity than a 40-watt light bulb and typically costing you less than $2 per month to use.

The insulated stainless steel tank is not under pressure, and the self-contained expansion chamber reduces dripping. The easy-to-install Quick-Connect fittings and improved connections reduce probability of kinked or twisted water lines. The dispenser comes installed with a power cord, and it's backed by a 1-year replacement warranty.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
H711-U-SN hot water dispenser kit with 5/8-gallon capacity water tank and Coronado faucet in satin nickel

Typical installation (view larger). Coronado faucet in satin nickel (view larger). AT A GLANCE
H711-U-SN CORONADO HOT WATER DISPENSER
 * 1300-watt, 5/8-gallon hot water tank produces up to 100 cups of hot water per hour
 * Near boiling temperature water ready for soups, tea, hot chocolate, and more
 * No stovetop boiling, no mess, no water waste
 * Fingertip thermostat adjustment from 140 to 190 degrees F
 * Includes open vent satin nickel Coronado faucet
 * 1-year replacement warranty
feature_bullets: Add convenience and elegance to your kitchen, the 1300-Watt hot water tank produces up to 100 cups of hot water per hour
Near boiling temperature water ready for soups, tea, no stovetop boiling no mess no water waste
Tank Dimensions: Height 11.2 inches, Width 6.8 inches, Depth 8.1 inches
Open vent satin nickel faucet included. Dispenses 60 cups per hour
Part number H711-U-SN is a combo unit which includes both hot water tank and satin finish faucet (AH-1300-C-hot water tank & H711-SN-satin finish hot water faucet)

Includes a safety feature that allows increases and decreases in temperature without risking over-expansion of the bladder. This may cause the faucet to drip from time to time, because of the open vented safety system.

specifications.Special Features: Self re-setting fuse to prevent dry start
specifications.Included Components: Water dispenser and tankWater Dispenser Faucet & Tank
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars828 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
